docs.title: AZD for AI Developers Workshop
docs.text:
[!IMPORTANT] This workshop is instrumented with a workshop guide that you can preview in your local browser. To get started, you must launch GitHub Codespaces on the repo—then wait until you see an active VS Code terminal and type: mkdocs serve > /dev/null 2>&1 & You should see a pop-up dialog to open the preview page in a browser.

Welcome to the hands-on workshop for learning Azure Developer CLI (AZD) with a focus on AI application deployment. This workshop helps you gain an applied understanding of AZD templates in 3 steps:

  1. Discovery - find the template that is right for you.
  2. Deployment - deploy and validate that it works
  3. Customization - modify and iterate to make it yours!

Over the course of this workshop, you will also be introduced to core developer tools and workflows, to help you streamline your end-to-end development journey.

📚 Course Home AZD For Beginners 📖 Documentation Get started with AI templates 🛠️AI Templates Azure AI Foundry Templates 🚀 Next Steps Take The Challenge

docs.title: Workshop Overview
docs.text:
Duration: 3-4 hours Level: Beginner to Intermediate Prerequisites: Familiarity with Azure, AI concepts, VS Code & command-line tools.

This is a hands-on workshop where you learn by doing. Once you have completed the exercises, we recommend reviewing the AZD For Beginners curriculum to continue your learning journey into Security and Productivity best practices.

Time Module Objective 15 mins Introduction Set the stage, understand the goals 30 mins Select AI Template Explore options and pick starter 30 mins Validate AI Template Deploy default solution to Azure 30 mins Deconstruct AI Template Explore structure and configuration 30 mins Configure AI Template Activate and try available features 30 mins Customize AI Template Adapt the template to your needs 30 mins Teardown Infrastructure Cleanup and release resources 15 mins Wrap-Up & Next Steps Learning resources, Workshop challenge

docs.title: What You'll Learn
docs.text:
Think of the AZD Template as a learning sandbox to explore various capabilities and tools for end-to-end development on Azure AI Foundry. By the end of this workshop, you should have an intuitive sense for various tools and concepts in this context.

Concept Objective Azure Developer CLI Understand tool commands and workflows AZD Templates Understand project structure and config Azure AI Agent Provision & deploy Azure AI Foundry project Azure AI Search Enable context engineering with agents Observability Explore tracing, monitoring and evaluations Red Teaming Explore adversarial testing and mitigations

docs.title: Workshop Modules
docs.text:
Ready to get started? Navigate through the workshop modules:

  • Module 1: Select AI Template
  • Module 2: Validate AI Template
  • Module 3: Deconstruct AI Template
  • Module 4: Configure AI Template
  • Module 5: Customize AI Template
  • Module 6: Teardown Infrastructure
  • Module 7: Wrap-up & Next Steps

docs.title: Have feedback?
docs.text: Post an issue on this repo (tag it Workshop) or join us on Discord and post to our #get-help channel

docs.title: 🗺️ Workshop Guide
docs.text: This guide follows a four-step "Deconstruct to Learn" approach: Discover, Deploy, Deconstruct, and Customize. Each section builds your understanding of Azure Developer CLI (azd) and AI App Templates through hands-on practice."

docs.title: 1. Discover
docs.text:
Learn the fundamentals of AZD and Templates

  1. Azure Developer CLI - Meet Your Contractor
  2. AZD Templates - Learn about Blueprints
  3. Template Sources - See Blueprint galleries
  4. Template Selection - Select a Starter

docs.title: 2. Deploy
docs.text:
Provision and deploy your chosen template to Azure

  1. GitHub Codespaces - Setup Your Workspace
  2. Deploy Application - Install Pre-fab Home
  3. Validate Features - Do A Home Inspection
  4. Explore Application - Start Living There

docs.title: 3. Deconstruct
docs.text:
Understand the anatomy of your deployed solution

  1. Understand azure.yaml - The Construction Schedule
  2. Understand infra/ - The Construction Materials
  3. Understand src/ - The Pre-Fab Starter Home
  4. Understand .azure/ - The Permits & Passcodes
  5. Understand README - The Homeowner Manual

docs.title: 4. Customize
docs.text:
Extend your solution with new capabilities

  1. Add AI Agent - Get a New Roommate
  2. Add AI Search - Bring My Furniture In
  3. Add AI Models - Change Utility Provider
  4. Add Evaluations - Do Regular Inspections
  5. Activate Tracing & Monitoring - Get Utility Dashboard
  6. Activate Red Teaming Scan - Protect From Home Invasion

docs.title: 5. Challenge
docs.text:
Apply your skills to new scenarios

  1. Customize Your Template - Update Your Kitchen
  2. Deconstruct New Template - Move To A Bigger Home

Ready to begin? Start with Azure Developer CLI!

docs.title: Azure Developer CLI
docs.text:
By the end of this section you should be able to:

  • Describe what Azure Developer CLI is
  • Describe core Azure Developer CLI commands
  • Install azd and try out commands in practice
  • Explain how azd acts as a "general contractor" for Azure solutions

docs.title: 4. Summary
docs.text:
LAB TIME - 01: Try Azure Developer CLI

ASK COPILOT

  • Explain the difference between 'azd init', 'azd provision', and 'azd deploy' commands
  • What are the advantages of using azd compared to manually deploying resources via the Azure portal?

docs.title: AZD Templates
docs.text:
By the end of this section you should be able to:

  • Describe what azd templates are and their purpose
  • Identify the key components of an azd template structure
  • Explain how templates serve as blueprints for Azure solutions
  • Compare different types of azd templates available

docs.title: 4. Summary
docs.text:
LAB TIME - 02: Explore AZD Templates

ASK COPILOT

  • What are the key differences between azd templates for web apps vs. AI applications?
  • How do I determine which azd template components are mandatory vs. optional?

docs.title: Template Sources
docs.text:
By the end of this section you should be able to:

  • Locate official azd template galleries and repositories
  • Navigate the Awesome AZD templates collection
  • Identify AI App Templates specific to AI solutions
  • Search for templates based on technology stack and use case

docs.title: 4. Summary
docs.text:
LAB TIME - 03: Discover Template Sources

ASK COPILOT

docs.title: Template Selection
docs.text:
By the end of this section you should be able to:

docs.title: 4. Summary
docs.text:

docs.title: 01: Try Azure Developer CLI
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will install the Azure Developer CLI (azd) on your development environment, authenticate with Azure, and explore core azd commands. You'll learn how to check your installation, view available templates, and understand the basic workflow of using azd as your "general contractor" for Azure deployments.

docs.title: 02: Explore AZD Templates
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will explore the structure and components of azd templates. You'll examine key files like azure.yaml, understand the infra/ and src/ folder organization, and identify what makes a template reusable. This lab will help you recognize patterns across different template types and understand how templates serve as blueprints for Azure solutions.

docs.title: 03: Discover Template Sources
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will navigate official azd template galleries including the Awesome AZD collection and Azure AI App Templates. You'll learn how to search for templates based on technology stack, filter by use case, and evaluate template quality indicators like stars, recent updates, and documentation completeness.

docs.title: 04: Select Your Template
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will apply evaluation criteria to select the most appropriate azd template for the retail chatbot scenario. You'll compare architecture diagrams, review feature lists, assess tech stack compatibility, and make an informed decision on which starter template best matches your requirements.

docs.title: 05: Setup GitHub Codespaces
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will create a GitHub Codespace for your selected azd template. You'll fork the template repository, launch a cloud-based development environment, explore the devcontainer configuration, and verify that all required tools and dependencies are installed and ready for development.

docs.title: 06: Deploy Your Application
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will execute your first full deployment using azd. You'll authenticate with Azure, set environment variables, run 'azd up' to provision infrastructure and deploy the application, and monitor the deployment process. You'll learn to interpret deployment logs and troubleshoot common issues.

docs.title: 07: Validate App Features
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will verify that your deployment was successful by checking Azure resources in the portal, testing application endpoints, and validating AI chatbot functionality. You'll review deployment logs, check resource configurations, and perform essential health checks to ensure everything is working correctly.

docs.title: 08: Explore the Application
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will interact with your deployed application through its user interface. You'll submit sample queries to the chatbot, observe how requests flow from frontend to backend, explore different features, and understand how the various components work together to deliver the AI-powered experience.

docs.title: 09: Explore azure.yaml
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will examine the azure.yaml manifest file in detail. You'll identify service definitions, understand hooks and event handlers, learn about environment variables, and see how this file orchestrates the entire deployment workflow. You'll also practice modifying the manifest to add custom configurations.

docs.title: 10: Explore Infra Folder
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will dive into the infra/ folder to understand infrastructure-as-code. You'll examine Bicep files, identify Azure resources being provisioned, understand module organization and parameters, and learn how to modify infrastructure definitions to add or change Azure services.

docs.title: 11: Explore Src Folder
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will navigate the src/ directory to understand the application code structure. You'll identify frontend and backend components, trace how the application integrates with Azure services, locate configuration files, and understand how environment variables are used for service authentication.

docs.title: 12: Explore .azure Folder
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will explore the .azure/ folder to understand how azd manages deployment state and environment-specific configurations. You'll examine .env files, learn about sensitive information storage, and practice managing multiple environments (dev, staging, production) using azd environment commands.

docs.title: 13: Explore README
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will thoroughly review the template's README and documentation. You'll interpret architecture diagrams, identify prerequisites, follow setup instructions, review the troubleshooting guide, and learn how to find answers to common questions. This lab emphasizes the importance of documentation in understanding and maintaining templates.

docs.title: 14: Add an AI Agent
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will integrate an AI agent into your application. You'll configure agent capabilities, define custom instructions and tools, connect the agent to your data sources, and test agent responses. You'll learn how agents differ from simple chatbots and how to validate agent behavior.

docs.title: 15: Add AI Search
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will provision Azure AI Search resources and configure search indexes for your product catalog. You'll implement retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) patterns, populate indexes with sample data, tune search parameters, and test how search enhances your chatbot's ability to provide accurate, grounded responses.

docs.title: 16: Add AI Models
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will deploy Azure OpenAI models to your solution. You'll configure model endpoints, manage API keys, compare different models (GPT-4, GPT-4o, GPT-3.5), and set up fallback configurations. You'll learn how to optimize model selection based on cost, performance, and use case requirements.

docs.title: 17: Add Evaluations
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will implement AI evaluation frameworks to assess your chatbot's quality. You'll define evaluation metrics for relevance, coherence, and groundedness, create test datasets with diverse customer queries, run automated evaluations, and analyze results to identify areas for improvement.

docs.title: 18: Add Tracing & Monitoring
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will enable Application Insights for comprehensive observability. You'll configure distributed tracing for your AI agent application, create monitoring dashboards for key metrics, set up alerts for critical issues, and learn how to use telemetry data to troubleshoot production problems.

docs.title: 19: Add Red Teaming
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will implement security testing for your AI chatbot. You'll learn about common AI vulnerabilities like prompt injection and jailbreaking, configure PyRIT or similar tools for automated security scanning, run red team tests, and implement mitigations to protect your application from adversarial attacks.

docs.title: 20: Customize a Template
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will customize your template to add new features specific to your retail scenario. You'll plan modifications, update both application code and infrastructure resources, test changes locally, redeploy using azd, and document your customizations for team collaboration.

docs.title: 21: Create New Template
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will apply the complete deconstruction process to a new azd template of your choice. You'll select a different template, deploy it, analyze its structure, compare it with your previous template, and build confidence in quickly understanding and adapting unfamiliar codebases.
